name: Orange Juice
history: Orange Juice is a staple beverage around the world, particularly popular as a breakfast drink. Originating from oranges, which have been cultivated since ancient times, orange juice is valued for its refreshing taste and health benefits.
description: Orange Juice is a refreshing and nutritious drink made by squeezing or pressing the fresh pulp of oranges. It's known for its bright flavor, high vitamin C content, and is often consumed fresh for the best taste and nutritional value.

equipment.name: juicer or citrus press
equipment.description: For extracting juice from the oranges.

instructions.title: Prepare the Oranges
instructions.description: Roll the oranges on a flat surface to loosen the juice. Cut them in half and remove any seeds.

instructions.title: Extract the Juice
instructions.description: Using a juicer or citrus press, squeeze the juice from the oranges. Strain the juice to remove any pulp, if desired.

instructions.title: Sweeten (Optional)
instructions.description: If desired, add sugar or honey to sweeten the juice and stir well.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Pour the orange juice into glasses, over ice cubes if preferred. Serve immediately for the freshest taste.

tips: Use ripe and sweet oranges for the best flavor.
Avoid over-squeezing the pulp, as it can make the juice bitter.
variations: Mix with other fruit juices like apple or carrot for a different flavor.
Add a pinch of salt or a splash of lemon juice for an enhanced taste.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed immediately. Can be refrigerated for up to 24 hours.
storage.instructions: Store in a sealed container in the refrigerator.

presentationTips: Serve in clear glasses to showcase the vibrant color of the juice.
Garnish with an orange slice or a sprig of mint.
